channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The Pitt season 2 episode 3 beautifully proves why Dana is the HBO Max show's best character — and it's all thanks to this split-second scene you've definitely missed
item.description: The Pitt season 2 episode 3 isn't as explosive as the previous two episodes – but it's quietly confirmed why Dana is the biggest hero of the bunch.

item.title: Dyson's biggest product innovations, ranked from game-changer to gimmick
item.description: I've tested most of Dyson's gadgets – these are the features that blew me away and the ones that turned out to be downgrades in disguise.

item.title: Palmer Luckey says the coolest thing about Anduril expanding to Long Beach is the fighter jets
item.description: Anduril on Thursday announced its plans to expand its Southern California presence with a major campus in Long Beach, the town where founder Palmer Luckey grew up.

item.title: TikTok Creates Legal Entity to Eventually Maybe Possibly Sell to U.S. Investors (Don’t Call It a Done Deal)
item.description: An entity has been created and a deadline has been avoided, as the TikTok deal drags on.

item.title: I’ve tested plenty of ereaders but the Onyx Boox Go 7 is the first Android-powered ebook reader I really like
item.description: The Boox Go 7 is a fantastic Kindle Oasis replacement, with excellent performance and a long feature list – but it will cost you.

item.title: TikTok annonce créer une co-entreprise aux États-Unis pour y éviter son interdiction
item.description: TikTok a annoncé jeudi dans un communiqué avoir créé une co-entreprise aux États-Unis pour y éviter son interdiction, mettant fin à une longue saga judiciaire.

item.title: The TikTok deal is done, finally
item.description: Just over a year after it briefly disappeared from app stores, TikTok in the US is now part of a new entity, TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC. With approval from both the US and China closing on the schedule laid out in December, ByteDance's ownership of the new joint venture is now only 19.9 percent […]

item.title: Yes, I’m nodding at nothing — AirPods Pro head gesture controls are that good
item.description: When the temperatures drop, and you don't want to touch your iPhone or AirPods, gesture controls are a hand-saver. Here's how to set them up for Apple's excellent Bluetooth audio device.

item.title: Ring can verify videos now, but that might not help you with most AI fakes
item.description: Ring has launched a new Ring Verify tool that the company says can "verify that Ring videos you receive haven't been edited or changed." But since Ring won't verify videos that have been altered in any way, it probably won't be able to verify those videos you see on TikTok that look like they're from […]

item.title: Beyond Good and Evil 2 somehow survived the purge at Ubisoft
item.description: In what world does Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake get canceled amid corporate restructuring and yet BG&E2 does not? "Beyond Good & Evil 2 remains a priority for us in the context of our strategy centered around Open World Adventures," an unnamed Ubisoft spokesperson told Kotaku and Insider Gaming. The original Beyond […]

item.title: OpenAI is coming for those sweet enterprise dollars in 2026
item.description: OpenAI has reportedly appointed Barret Zoph to lead its push into enterprise just a week after Zoph rejoined the company.

item.title: Vimeo starts layoffs after acquisition by Bending Spoons
item.description: Vimeo is in the process of laying off some of its global staff after being acquired last year by Bending Spoons for $1.38B.

item.title: Sorry MAGA, Turns Out People Still Like ‘Woke’ Art
item.description: From Black vampires gobbling up Oscar nominations to gay pro hockey players dominating the culture, diverse stories broke through in an environment that’s increasingly hostile to them.
